{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-07-A |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=A |Title=Photographs of a typical example of macroscopic haematuria |Description=None |Rubric=Multimedia content |Contributors=Charles Dariane,Bruno Moulin |Order=7}}
'''Figure 3.''' Urine collecting bag reflecting macroscopic haematuria [[File:Figure 3 urine collection bag HUbis.jpg|neant|vignette|'''Figure 3.''' Urine collecting bag reflecting macroscopic haematuria]]

properties.question: What does macroscopic haematuria in a urine sample indicate?
properties.option_a: Presence of bacteria indicating a urinary tract infection
properties.option_b: High levels of protein suggesting kidney disease
properties.option_c: Visible blood in the urine, which may be due to various conditions
